7.verse_text: My son, pay close attention and don't forget what I tell you to do. Let my instructions be your greatest treasure. and write them in your mind. and make common sense your closest friend. from the flattering words of someone else's wife. I once happened to see sometime after dark. turned the corner and was walking by the house of an unfaithful wife. like a woman of the street with only one thing in mind. who are loud and restless and never stay at home, waiting to trap a man. and with no sense of shame, she said: and there is enough meat left over for a feast. and here you are! are bright-colored cloth from Egypt. with perfume made of myrrh, aloes, and cinnamon. and make love all night. and he's far away. and he won't be back home before the middle of the month.' with all of her sweet talk and her flattery. like an ox on the way to be slaughtered, or like a fool on the way He was no more than a bird rushing into a trap, without knowing it would cost him his life. to what I have said. that kind of woman or let yourself be misled by someone like her. the downfall and destruction of a lot of men. leading straight down to the world of the dead.

30.verse_text: These are the sayings and the message of Agur son of Jakeh. Someone cries out to God, 'I am completely worn out! to be considered human. and I don't understand what God is like.' and come back down? Has anyone grabbed hold of the wind? Has anyone wrapped up the sea or marked out boundaries for the earth? If you know of any who have done such things, then tell me their names and their children's names. and it's a shield for all who come to him for safety. He will correct you and show that you are a liar. I want you to do for me before I die: and don't let me be too poor or too rich. Give me just what I need. I might forget about you; if I don't have enough, I might steal and disgrace your name. something bad about one of the slaves. That slave will curse you, and you will be in trouble. and even their mother; but they are stained by sin. and act like snobs; that they gobble up the poor and homeless. each named 'Give me!' There are three or four things that are never satisfied: and a childless wife, the thirsty earth and a flaming fire. or disobey your mother– crows will peck out your eyes, and buzzards will eat the rest of you. I cannot understand: or snakes crawl on rocks, how ships sail the ocean or people fall in love. 'Sleeping with another man is as natural as eating.' that make the earth tremble and are unbearable: a fool who eats too much, who finds a husband, and a slave who takes the place of the woman who owns her. are small but very wise: but store up food all summer long; but live among the rocks; but march like an army; in your hand, but sneak into palaces. really strut around: who rule the jungle, those mountain goats, and those rulers or planning something evil, then stop it now! you get butter; if you pound on your nose, you get blood– and if you stay angry, you get in trouble.
